result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald S Brower was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Ronald S Brower in court with attorney Erin J. Preston.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
In 15CF661, deft will plead to charge. State will dismiss 14CF948. The State recommends w/held sent - 12 mos prob; RCJ = CFTS, counseling, no alc/cs, AODA/FT and other approp conditions
P-NC
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

Parties agree to waive PSI.

BTC: guilty as above. $500 + cc, DNA sample & costs, FAW/vote. Bond to apply. Balance to be paid at a rate of $50/mo to begin 3/15

Attorney Erin J. Preston in court.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
No appearance by defendant at 9:07 for 8:45 plea/sentencing hearing.  State is not asking for bench warrant.

Defendant Ronald S Brower in court with attorney Erin J. Preston.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for ADA Repischak for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Defense indicates that Mr. Repischak told her that the victim is in the state of Florida and a new offer has been extended. Defense is asking for COP/SEH  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 6, 2017 at 08:45 am.
